body:
So the first commit failed because the pip we have on the CircleCI VM is too old to know about constraints files. So I added a commit to update pip, and I used a requirements file with hashes to verify the pip we're getting. According to a forum thread I found, the Ubuntu image we're using has pip 8.1.1 installed on it, and yet CI seems to be complaining about the hash syntax in the requirements file. 

I tried `sudo pip` for installing, and it seemed to complain about the newlines in the requirements file. Weird. `pip` alone instead said that `--hash` was not an option, but helpfully said it was using pip 7.1.2.

I'm not entirely sure the best way to proceed. Should I try installing pip from the ubuntu software repos? Should I use [pipstrap](https://github.com/erikrose/pipstrap)? Should I try something else?
